oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A selenium-bridged mixed-metal cluster, (CO)(5) (PPh3)(2)FePt2(mu(3)-Se)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PANNEERSELVAM, K
LU, TH
TUNG, SF
DASH, AK
MATHUR, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: acetylenic bond reduction
structural characterization
spectroscopic characterization
coordination chemistry
fe2(co)6(mu-se2)
derivatives
ligands
crystal
complex
te)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Stirring at room temperature of [(CO)(6)Fe-2{mu-SeC(H)=C(CH2OH)Se}] with Pt(PPh3)(4) or Pt(C2H4)(PPh3)(2) in dichloromethane affords the mu(3)-Se-bridged mixed-metal cluster pentacarbonyl-1 kappa(3)C,2 kappa C,3 kappa C-mu(3)-selenido-1:2:3 kappa(3)Se-bis(triphenylphosphine)-2 kappa P,3 kappa P-irondiplatinum (2 Fe-Pt), [FePt2(mu(3)-Se)(C18H15P)(2)(CO)(5)]. The structure can be described as an FePt2Se butterfly; each Pt atom is coordinated by one CO and one PPh3 group, whereas the Fe atom is bonded to three CO groups. The Fe atom is in a distorted octahedral environment. The bridging Se atom is bonded to the open triangular array of FePt2 in a mu(3) coordination mode. The geometry around the Pt atoms is distorted square planar.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: ACTA CRYSTALLOGRAPHICA SECTION C-CRYSTAL STRUCTURE COMMUNICATIONS, 55(), 1250-1253
